intro: Strophioblachia glandulosa var. tonkinensis, commonly known as the Tonkin glandular strobilanthera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its glandular leaves and small, tubular flowers that often have a distinctive coloration. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
